meanings.definition: Remove the dead blossoms from (a plant) to encourage further blooming.
meanings.sent1: I deadheaded the roses to make them grow more flowers.
meanings.sent2: She deadheaded the daisies in her garden to help them bloom again.
meanings.sent3: The gardener deadheaded the wilting flowers, giving them a chance to shine once more.
meanings.sent4: By deadheading the plants, you are giving them a fresh start to flourish.
meanings.sent5: Deadheading the garden is like giving it a second chance to be beautiful.
